Frenki Lampard je zaslužio nagradu, Čelsi spreman da potroši 170.000.000 evra na pojačanja
Plavci čekaju kao zapete puške ako stigne zeleno svetlo od UEFA

05 Nov 2019

Čelsi je zbog kazne UEFA prespavao prethodni prelazni rok što se tiče kupovina, a izgubio je najboljeg igrača Edena Azara. Dovoljno da se mnogi navijači Plavaca uplaše kako će ekipa reagovati bez sveže krvi. Pogotovo što je tada došao novi i neiskusni trener Frenk Lampard i što je Čelsi klub koji je navikao da u svakom prelaznom roku dodaje ozbiljna pojačanja
Podsetimo, zbog kršenja nekoliko pravila vezanih za transfere i registraciju igrača mlađih od 18 godina, UEFA je kaznila Čelsi zabranom kupovine novih igrača u dva prelazna roka. Čelsi je prvi deo kazne odradio letos kada nije doveo nijednog fudbalera, a drugi bi trebalo da odradi sledećeg januara i da tek od sledećeg leta normalno funkcioniše na fudbalskom tržištu.
Ispostavilo se da je zabrana kupovine igrača bila najbolja stvar koja je mogla da se desi Lampardu i Čelsiju. Pritisak je spao, a Frenki je hrabro prestrojio ekipu i dao šansu mladim fudbalerima. Sklonio je iz startne postave Žirua i kaldio se na Abrahama koji je postao prvi strelac lige. Lansirao je Mejson Maunta koji je čak stigao i do dresa reprezentacije Engleske, a potpuno je oduševio mladi štoper Fikajo Tomori koji se pokazao kao sjajna zamena za Luiza, a Kristijan Pulišić polako „staje u kopačke“ Edena Azara. Još kada u top formu uđe sveže oporavljeni Kalum Hadson Odoi i kada se od povrede oporavi Ruben Loftus Čik, Čelsi će imati još jači sastav oslonjen na gomilu igrača iz svoje škole koja je godinama beležila dobre rezultate u mlađim kategorijama, ali treneri u prvom timu nisu imali hrabrosti da pruže šansu toj deci u seniorima.   
Ipak, Čelsi se nada da bi već od zime opet mogao da kupuje nove igrače i doda još kvaliteta. Sportski arbitražni sud u Lozani trenutno razmatra žalbu engleskog velikana, a na Stamford Bridžu su optimistični da bi kazna mogla da se smanji sa dva prelazna roka na jedan, i da bi od zime mogli normalno da funkcionišu. Saslušanje je zakazano za 20. novembar, a od njega će zavisiti i neki planovi trenera Frenka Lamparda.„Naravno da ćemo sa posebnim interesovanjem pratiti saslušanje u Arbitražnom sudu. Klub poput Čelsija uvek mora da traži mogućnosti da pojača ekipu u vreme prelaznog roka. Ukoliko to situacija dopusti i ako neki igrači budu mogli da pojačaju naš tim, mi ćemo pokušati da ih dovedemo“, rekao je Lampard.
Ostrvski Telegraf je javio da bi Čelsi odmah u januaru mogao da potroši oko 170.000.000 evra s obzirom na zaradu od oko 200.000.000 evra od letošnjih prodaja Azara, Luiza, Morate i još nekih manje bitnih igrača.
A šta bi Čelsi mogao da kupi za te pare? Pa, makar tri prava pojačanja.
Jedno se već nazire. Čelsijeva želja je francuski napadač Musa Dembele iz Liona kojeg je za januar već naciljali i Mančester Junajted. Ima samo 23 godine, a već zavidno iskustvo iza sebe i sedam sezona profesionalnog fudbala u Premijer ligi, Seltiku i Lionu. Ostrvo mu nije nepoznat ambijent, s obzirom da je lansiran u Fulamu i da je blistao u Seltiku. Na Stamford Bridžu bi mogao da zameni nezadovoljnog Žirua koji će skoro sigurno otići naredne zime, s obzirom da je u poslednjoj godini ugovora. Čelsijev jedini problem je što Dembelea žarko želi i Mančester Junajted i označio ga je kao prvu metu za januar. Ako Čelsi ne dobije zeleno svetlo iz UEFA, na leto bi moglo da bude kasno. Mada, Lionu odgovara da zadrži igrača do leta.
Dok bi Dembele bio pojačanje u napadu, ostale kupovine bi mogle da dođu u odbrani. Lampard je već promovisao Tomorija i Risa Džejmsa, ali ni to mu nije dovoljno. Pominje se da bi želeo da vrati Natana Akea iz Bornmuta. On je ponikao u Čelsiju, da bi ga Bornmut pre dve i po godine kupio za nešto više od 20.000.000 evra. Ali je Čelsi tada insistirao na povratnoj klauzuli i sada može da ga otkupi nazad za 40.000.000 evra. Na kraju, spekuliše se i da bi Ben Čilvel iz Lestera mogao da pojača levi bok.

Frankie Lampard earned the award, Chelsea ready to spend € 170,000,000 on reinforcements
The swimmers are waiting like shotguns if the green light from UEFA arrives

05 Nov 2019

Chelsea lost the previous transfer deadline due to a UEFA penalty and lost their best player, Eden Azar. Enough for many Plavac fans to be scared of how the team would react without fresh blood. Especially when then new and inexperienced coach Frank Lampard came along and what a Chelsea club he was used to adding serious reinforcements to at every interim deadline
Recall, for violating several rules regarding transfers and registration of players under the age of 18, UEFA has fined Chelsea by banning the purchase of new players for two transitional periods. Chelsea did the first part of the sentence this summer when it did not bring any football players, and the second is due next January and will only function normally in the football market next summer.
It turned out that banning player purchases was the best thing that could have happened to Lampard and Chelsea. The pressure subsided, and Frankie courageously reorganized the team and gave the young footballers a chance. He dropped out of the Jury starting lineup and bet on Abraham who became the league's first goal scorer. He launched the Mason Mount, which even made it to the England national team jersey, and was completely delighted by young stopper Ficajo Tomori, who proved to be a great replacement for Louise, and Christian Pulisic is slowly “slipping into the shoes” of Eden Azar. When freshly recovered Kalum Hudson Odoi comes into top form, and when Ruben Loftus Chick recovers from injury, Chelsea will have an even stronger lineup relying on a bunch of players from their school who have been performing well in the younger categories for years, but first-team coaches have not had the courage to give those kids a chance at seniors.
Still, Chelsea hopes to be able to buy new players again from the winter and add more quality. The Lausanne Sports Arbitration Tribunal is currently considering an appeal by an English major, and at Stamford Bridge they are optimistic that the sentence could be reduced from two transitional periods to one, and that they could function normally from winter. The hearing is scheduled for Nov. 20, and some of coach Frank Lampard's plans will depend on him. "Of course, we will be watching the Arbitral Tribunal with special interest. A club like Chelsea must always look for opportunities to strengthen the team at the time of the transition. If the situation allows and if some players can strengthen our team, we will try to bring them in, "Lampard said.
The Island Telegraph reported that Chelsea could spend around € 170,000,000 in January immediately, with earnings of about € 200,000,000 from sales of Azar, Louise, Morata and some other minor players this year.
And what could Chelsea buy for that money? Well, at least three real reinforcements.
One is already in sight. Chelsea's wish is French striker Musa Dembele from Lyon, who has already been targeted by Manchester United in January. He is only 23 years old and already has an enviable experience behind him and seven seasons of professional football in the Premier League, Celtic and Lyon. The island is not unfamiliar to him, since it was launched in Fulham and shone in Celtic. At Stamford Bridge, he could replace the disgruntled Giroux who will almost certainly leave next winter, considering he is in his final year of contract. Chelsea's only problem is that Dembele is fervently wanted by Manchester United and has been labeled his first target for January. If Chelsea doesn't get the green light from UEFA, it could be late in the summer. However, it suits Lyon to keep the player until summer.
While Dembele would be stepping up on offense, other purchases could come in defense. Lampard has already promoted Tomory and Rhys James, but that's not enough for him either. It is mentioned that he would like to bring back Nathan Ake from Bournemouth. He went to Chelsea to buy Bournemouth two and a half years ago for just over € 20,000,000. But Chelsea then insisted on a return clause and can now buy it back for € 40,000,000. Finally, there is speculation that Ben Chillwell of Leicester could strengthen his left flank.
